title: Usage of resource() is broken (e.g. in Atlas) due to version confusion
body:
a regression:
```
$ spack install atlas
==> Installing atlas
==> Using cached archive: /Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/cache/atlas/atlas-3.10.2.tar.bz2
==> Using cached archive: /Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/cache/atlas/lapack-3.10.2.tgz
==> Already staged atlas-3.10.2-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p in /Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/stage/atlas-3.10.2-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p
==> Already staged resource-lapack-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p in /Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/stage/resource-lapack-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p
==> Already patched atlas
==> Building atlas [Package]
==> Executing phase : 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 255:
    '../configure' '--prefix=/Users/davydden/spack/opt/spack/darwin-sierra-x86_64/clang-8.0.0-apple/atlas-3.10.2-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p' '--shared' '-b' '64' '-C' 'ic' '/Users/davydden/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang' '-C' 'if' '/Users/davydden/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/gfortran' '--with-netlib-lapack-tarfile=/Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/stage/resource-lapack-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p/lapack-3.10.2.tgz'
/Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/atlas/package.py:112, in install:
     73       def install(self, spec, prefix):
     74
     75           options = []
     76           if '+shared' in spec:
     77               options.extend([
     78                   '--shared'
     79               ])
     80               # TODO: for non GNU add '-Fa', 'alg', '-fPIC' ?
     81
     82           # configure for 64-bit build
     83           options.extend([
     84               '-b', '64'
     85           ])
     86
     87           # set compilers:
     88           options.extend([
     89               '-C', 'ic', spack_cc,
     90               '-C', 'if', spack_f77
     91           ])
     92
     93           # Lapack resource to provide full lapack build. Note that
     94           # ATLAS only provides a few LAPACK routines natively.
     95           lapack_stage = self.stage[1]
     96           lapack_tarfile = os.path.basename(lapack_stage.fetcher.url)
     97           lapack_tarfile_path = join_path(lapack_stage.path, lapack_tarfile)
     98           options.append('--with-netlib-lapack-tarfile=%s' % lapack_tarfile_path)
     99
     100          with working_dir('spack-build', create=True):
     101              configure = Executable('../configure')
     102              configure('--prefix=%s' % prefix, *options)
     103              make()
     104              make('check')
     105              make('ptcheck')
     106              make('time')
     107              if '+shared' in spec:
     108                  with working_dir('lib'):
     109                      make('shared_all')
     110
     111              make("install")
  >> 112              self.install_test()
```
build log says:
```
Cannot find '/Users/davydden/spack/var/spack/stage/resource-lapack-uooc5yhhrkorp2ymts5zovdaoay5g35p/lapack-3.10.2.tgz'
```
The actual file is actually called
```
lapack-3.5.0.tgz
```
whereas `3.10.2` is the version of `atlas`. The bug appears in the packages via 
```
lapack_tarfile = os.path.basename(lapack_stage.fetcher.url)
```
